list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Enhance ServiceOrder and Trade Handling
Added new fields such as `TakeProfit`, `CreatedAt`, and `PositionId` to the `ServiceOrder` model and ensured they are properly populated throughout the codebase. Enhanced trade processing logic to handle different order responses, including distinct handling for market and limit orders, with improved logging and error handling. Included related entities in database queries to maintain consistency and integrity.

project.component: { "keyToString": { ".NET Launch Settings Profile.MetaTraderWorkerService.executor": "Debug", "ASKED_SHARE_PROJECT_CONFIGURATION_FILES": "true", "Publish to custom server.PublishToDebian.executor": "Run", "Publish to folder.PublishToFolder.executor": "Run", "RunOnceActivity.ShowReadmeOnStart": "true", "XThreadsFramesViewSplitterKey": "0.49871466", "git-widget-placeholder": "master", "ignore.virus.scanning.warn.message": "true", "node.js.detected.package.eslint": "true", "node.js.detected.package.tslint": "true", "node.js.selected.package.eslint": "(autodetect)", "node.js.selected.package.tslint": "(autodetect)", "nodejs_package_manager_path": "npm", "settings.editor.selected.configurable": "project.propVCSSupport.DirectoryMappings", "vue.rearranger.settings.migration": "true" } }

task.summary: Default task

Add initial implementation for MetaTraderWorkerService
This commit includes the setup for the MetaTraderWorkerService project. Added configurations, data model, HTTP services, and necessary project files like `appsettings.json`. The project structure and initial classes have been defined to support database interactions and API requests.

Add .gitignore and refactor OrderProcessor
Created a .gitignore file to exclude build artifacts and IDE-specific files. Refactored OrderProcessor to split out the trade opening logic into a new method, improving code readability and maintainability.

Add initial setup for MetaTraderWorkerService project
This commit includes the initial structure and key components for the MetaTraderWorkerService project. It adds app settings, HTTP services, data models, interfaces, and repository definitions, alongside essential configuration files like .gitignore and project settings.

Refactor MetaTraderOrder and add OrderActionType enum
Converted MetaTraderOrder's ActionType field to use the new OrderActionType enum and added a description field for comprehensive details. Implemented partial structure for cancelling orders within OrderProcessor, enhancing future extensibility.

Refactor code formatting for consistency
Consolidated property and method declarations into a single line where appropriate. Simplified conditionals and removed unnecessary braces. This improves readability and maintains a consistent coding style across the project.

Add order cancellation feature
Implemented functionality to cancel orders in the MetaTraderWorkerService. This includes the addition of the `CancelOrderDto` class, updates to the `OrderProcessor` class for handling order cancellations, and modifications to the `MetaApiService` and repositories to support the new feature.

Add order status checking functionality
Introduced order status checking to enhance order management. This feature includes a new OrderStatusWorker and OrderStatusService, updates to relevant repository methods, and integration in the Program setup. Also added handling for different order states in the MetaApiService and OrderProcessor.

Add TradeResultCode enum and update MetaTraderOrder
Introduced TradeResultCode enum for better order status handling. Refactored MetaTraderOrder to use the new enum in place of numeric codes and updated OrderProcessor logic accordingly. Adjusted OrderStatusService to utilize the new enum and refactored code for improved readability.

Add OrderStatusResponseDto and refactor order status handling.
Introduced OrderStatusResponseDto for a better structure of order status responses. Refactored OrderProcessor and OrderStatusService to utilize the new DTO and improved the order status update logic. Also, updated repository method names for clarity.

Refactor `OrderActionType` to `ActionType`
Renamed `OrderActionType` to `ActionType` for consistency. Updated references across multiple files including `MetaTraderOrder`, `InitialTradeSignal`, and `OrderProcessor`.

Rename MetaTraderOrderResponseDto and update related logic
Renamed MetaTraderOrderResponseDto to MetaTraderOpenTradeOrderResponseDto for clarity. Updated method signatures, type references, and field assignments to align with the new class name. Enhanced order status management by adding more descriptive fields to MetaTraderOrder.

Add TradeWorker and Trade processing features
Introduced TradeWorker to fetch and process active trades periodically. Added TradeProcessor and related interfaces, DTOs, and enums to manage trade operations. Registered the new worker and services in the application startup.

Rename models and properties to include MetaTrader prefix
Updated various class names and properties to include the MetaTrader prefix for consistency. This includes classes such as MetaTraderTrade, MetaTraderSignal, and MetaTraderInitialTradeSignal. Adjusted related references throughout the project to match the new naming conventions.

Update MetaTrader order processing and DTOs
Changed the type of 'Magic' property to long in DTO and updated 'OrderStatus' enum to include 'Executed'. Enhanced OrderProcessor with account ID configuration and modified order status handling for better accuracy. Replaced Console.WriteLine with Debug.WriteLine in HttpService for better debugging.

Refactor namespaces and organize services
Updated namespaces for consistency and moved relevant files into subdirectories. Enhanced readability by adjusting formatting and removing unused imports. Added `MetaTraderWorkerService.Services.TradeServices` and `MetaTraderWorkerService.Services.OrderServices` namespaces.

Update log delay and add logging for trade requests
Increased delay interval in TradeWorker to improve order spacing. Added logging in MetaApiService to track trade requests for better monitoring. Commented out `GetActiveTradesAsync` for future reactivation.

Add SignalCommandCode and enhance order processing
Introduced new SignalCommandCode values and integrated them into MetaTraderOrder. Enhanced OrderProcessor with added methods for handling position modifications and partial closures. Improved error handling and status updates for order cancellations.

Add trade repository and partial close handling
Introduced ITradeRepository and its implementation for managing trades. Enhanced OrderProcessor to handle partial close orders and added corresponding DTOs. Removed the obsolete TradeStatus enum, improving the overall trade management logic.

Add stop-loss modification functionality
Introduced request and response DTOs for modifying stop-loss. Updated MetaTraderTrade model and order processing logic to support the new stop-loss modification feature. Enhanced MetaApiService with a method to handle stop-loss updates and improved order status handling.

Add stop-loss modification functionality
Introduced request and response DTOs for modifying stop-loss. Updated MetaTraderTrade model and order processing logic to support stop-loss modifications. Enhanced MetaApiService to handle stop-loss updates and improved order status handling.

Update TradeWorker to process active trades and associate orders
This commit enhances the TradeWorker to retrieve and process active trades, associating them with corresponding orders in the database. It also includes updates to TradeState and TradeStatusResponseDto, and adds a new method in IOrderRepository for fetching orders by magic and symbol.

Refactor TradeWorker and order processing logic
Reformatted the TradeWorker and order processing methods for better code readability and maintainability. Simplified nested structures and improved error handling consistency across methods. Removed redundant default case statements.

Add ClosePrice to MetaTraderOrder
Introduced the ClosePrice property to the MetaTraderOrder model for better handling of order closing prices. This change augments existing order data and enhances the precision of order processing logic.

Update TradeWorker and repository for better trade management
Enhanced TradeWorker to handle trades and associate them with orders more accurately, adding a new method to fetch orders by MetaTrader order ID. Adjusted logic to update existing trades or create new ones if necessary, ensuring accurate database updates.

Refactor DTOs and update order processing logic
Standardized DTO classes with consistent JSON property mappings. Introduced ModifyStopLossRequestDto for specific stop-loss modifications. Improved order processing methods by aligning field names and ensuring accurate trade volume updates.

Refactor trade processing and history retrieval
Simplified TradeWorker by moving active trade processing logic to TradeProcessor. Added methods to TradeProcessor for processing active trades and retrieving trade history.

Add market price trading functionality
Introduced DTOs for opening trades by market price and updated MetaApiService and OrderProcessor to handle these trades. Implemented error handling for invalid prices by switching to market price orders, ensuring more accurate and efficient trading.

Add new order action processors and refactor OrderProcessor
Introduced new order action processors: StopLossToPriceProcessor, StopLossToBreakEvenProcessor, PartialPositionCloseProcessor, and SellLimitProcessor. Refactored OrderProcessor to use these processors dynamically, improving the order processing workflow.

Refactor StopLoss processors
Merged StopLossToBreakEvenProcessor and StopLossToPriceProcessor into a unified StopLossProcessor class. Updated OrderProcessor to use the new consolidated StopLossProcessor, simplifying the order processing workflow.

Add OrderAction processors to Program.cs
Registered multiple OrderAction processors with the DI container. This change ensures that specific order actions like BuyLimit, CancelOrder, PartialPositionClose, SellLimit, and StopLoss can be processed dynamically.

Refactor logger injection in order processors
Reorganized logger dependency injection in `SellLimitProcessor`, `BuyLimitProcessor`, and `BaseOpenTradeProcessor` classes. This adjustment ensures that `ILogger<T>` instances are properly utilized and passed to the base processor class.

Optimize order status checking and processing logic
Refactored the order status checking process to skip orders not in "ORDER_STATE_PLACED". Changed the delay for OrderStatusWorker to 1 second. Updated CancelOrderProcessor to handle order cancellations more accurately.

Add constructor to PartialPositionCloseProcessor
Introduced a constructor to the PartialPositionCloseProcessor class, ensuring proper initialization of logger, order repository, meta API service, and trade repository dependencies. Additionally, adjusted the partial volume calculation to ensure a minimum value of 0.01.

Refactor and add new trade processing functionality
Renamed and restructured existing processors and services for better organization. Added new TryToCloseProcessor and associated worker to handle 'Try to Close' trades. Introduced MarketService for retrieving market prices, and updated configuration settings to support new features.

Add Trade History Processing and Repository
Integrated trade history processing in TradeProcessor and added TradeHistoryRepository. Updated ApplicationDbContext to include MetaTraderTradeHistories DbSet and introduced essential methods for handling trade histories.

Increase delay and comment out trade status updates
Changed the delay interval in TradeWorker.cs from 5 seconds to 120 seconds to optimize performance and reduce CPU usage. Additionally, commented out sections in TradeProcessor.cs related to updating and closing trade statuses, to be revisited with enhanced trade history handling logic.

Add TradeHistoryRepository to DI container
Included TradeHistoryRepository in the dependency injection container to manage trade history operations. Updated IntelliJ IDEA configuration to reflect recent changes in the project setup.

Refactor trade history repository methods for consistency
Renamed repository methods to improve clarity and consistency by using `TradeHistoryId` instead of `Id`. Adjusted corresponding references in `TradeProcessor` and other classes. Additionally, ensured all date times are set to UTC kind to maintain

Refactor trade processing and add new service order handling
Commented out existing trade processing in various workers and moved it to the main `Worker` class. Introduced new `ServiceOrder` model and repository, as well as processors for handling service orders. Added logging and performance metrics tracking, updated logging levels in configurations.

Add dynamic stop-loss adjustment
Introduced PipCalculator for pip and point conversions. Enhanced TradeProcessor to dynamically update stop-loss based on current trade profit and implemented ServiceOrder for stop-loss updates.

Enhance ServiceOrder and Trade Handling
Added new fields such as `TakeProfit`, `CreatedAt`, and `PositionId` to the `ServiceOrder` model and ensured they are properly populated throughout the codebase. Enhanced trade processing logic to handle different order responses, including distinct handling for market and limit orders, with improved logging and error handling. Included related entities in database queries to maintain consistency and integrity.

MESSAGE.value:
Add trade repository and partial close handling
Introduced ITradeRepository and its implementation for managing trades. Enhanced OrderProcessor to handle partial close orders and added corresponding DTOs. Removed the obsolete TradeStatus enum, improving the overall trade management logic.

Add stop-loss modification functionality
Introduced request and response DTOs for modifying stop-loss. Updated MetaTraderTrade model and order processing logic to support the new stop-loss modification feature. Enhanced MetaApiService with a method to handle stop-loss updates and improved order status handling.

Add stop-loss modification functionality
Introduced request and response DTOs for modifying stop-loss. Updated MetaTraderTrade model and order processing logic to support stop-loss modifications. Enhanced MetaApiService to handle stop-loss updates and improved order status handling.

Update TradeWorker to process active trades and associate orders
This commit enhances the TradeWorker to retrieve and process active trades, associating them with corresponding orders in the database. It also includes updates to TradeState and TradeStatusResponseDto, and adds a new method in IOrderRepository for fetching orders by magic and symbol.

Update TradeWorker for active trade processing
Enhance TradeWorker to retrieve and associate active trades with orders in the database. Minor adjustments include updates to TradeState and TradeStatusResponseDto, and a new method in IOrderRepository for fetching orders by magic and symbol.

Refactor TradeWorker and order processing logic
Reformatted the TradeWorker and order processing methods for better code readability and maintainability. Simplified nested structures and improved error handling consistency across methods. Removed redundant default case statements.

Add ClosePrice to MetaTraderOrder
Introduced the ClosePrice property to the MetaTraderOrder model for better handling of order closing prices. This change augments existing order data and enhances the precision of order processing logic.

Update TradeWorker and repository for better trade management
Enhanced TradeWorker to handle trades and associate them with orders more accurately, adding a new method to fetch orders by MetaTrader order ID. Adjusted logic to update existing trades or create new ones if necessary, ensuring accurate database updates.

Refactor DTOs and update order processing logic
Standardized DTO classes with consistent JSON property mappings. Introduced ModifyStopLossRequestDto for specific stop-loss modifications. Improved order processing methods by aligning field names and ensuring accurate trade volume updates.

Refactor trade processing and history retrieval
Simplified TradeWorker by moving active trade processing logic to TradeProcessor. Added methods to TradeProcessor for processing active trades and retrieving trade history.

Add market price trading functionality
Introduced DTOs for opening trades by market price and updated MetaApiService and OrderProcessor to handle these trades. Implemented error handling for invalid prices by switching to market price orders, ensuring more accurate and efficient trading.

Add new order action processors and refactor OrderProcessor
Introduced new order action processors: StopLossToPriceProcessor, StopLossToBreakEvenProcessor, PartialPositionCloseProcessor, and SellLimitProcessor. Refactored OrderProcessor to use these processors dynamically, improving the order processing workflow.

Refactor StopLoss processors
Merged StopLossToBreakEvenProcessor and StopLossToPriceProcessor into a unified StopLossProcessor class. Updated OrderProcessor to use the new consolidated StopLossProcessor, simplifying the order processing workflow.

Add OrderAction processors to Program.cs
Registered multiple OrderAction processors with the DI container. This change ensures that specific order actions like BuyLimit, CancelOrder, PartialPositionClose, SellLimit, and StopLoss can be processed dynamically.

Refactor logger injection in order processors
Reorganized logger dependency injection in `SellLimitProcessor`, `BuyLimitProcessor`, and `BaseOpenTradeProcessor` classes. This adjustment ensures that `ILogger<T>` instances are properly utilized and passed to the base processor class.

Optimize order status checking and processing logic
Refactored the order status checking process to skip orders not in "ORDER_STATE_PLACED". Changed the delay for OrderStatusWorker to 1 second. Updated CancelOrderProcessor to handle order cancellations more accurately.

Add constructor to PartialPositionCloseProcessor
Introduced a constructor to the PartialPositionCloseProcessor class, ensuring proper initialization of logger, order repository, meta API service, and trade repository dependencies. Additionally, adjusted the partial volume calculation to ensure a minimum value of 0.01.

Refactor and add new trade processing functionality
Renamed and restructured existing processors and services for better organization. Added new TryToCloseProcessor and associated worker to handle 'Try to Close' trades. Introduced MarketService for retrieving market prices, and updated configuration settings to support new features.

Add Trade History Processing and Repository
Integrated trade history processing in TradeProcessor and added TradeHistoryRepository. Updated ApplicationDbContext to include MetaTraderTradeHistories DbSet and introduced essential methods for handling trade histories.

Increase delay and comment out trade status updates
Changed the delay interval in TradeWorker.cs from 5 seconds to 120 seconds to optimize performance and reduce CPU usage. Additionally, commented out sections in TradeProcessor.cs related to updating and closing trade statuses, to be revisited with enhanced trade history handling logic.

Add TradeHistoryRepository to DI container
Included TradeHistoryRepository in the dependency injection container to manage trade history operations. Updated IntelliJ IDEA configuration to reflect recent changes in the project setup.
Refactor trade history repository methods for consistency

Refactor trade processing and add new service order handling
Commented out existing trade processing in various workers and moved it to the main `Worker` class. Introduced new `ServiceOrder` model and repository, as well as processors for handling service orders. Added logging and performance metrics tracking, updated logging levels in configurations.

Add dynamic stop-loss adjustment
Introduced PipCalculator for pip and point conversions. Enhanced TradeProcessor to dynamically update stop-loss based on current trade profit and implemented ServiceOrder for stop-loss updates.

Enhance ServiceOrder and Trade Handling
Added new fields such as `TakeProfit`, `CreatedAt`, and `PositionId` to the `ServiceOrder` model and ensured they are properly populated throughout the codebase. Enhanced trade processing logic to handle different order responses, including distinct handling for market and limit orders, with improved logging and error handling. Included related entities in database queries to maintain consistency and integrity.

Enhanced trade processing logic to handle different order responses, including distinct handling for market and limit orders, with improved logging and error handling. Included related entities in database queries to maintain consistency and integrity.
